name: Carlos
description: Carlos is a Mexican FGLI student who is passionate about Biology, he was seperated from his family at just 16 years old, and lived with his cousin for the entirety of high school. He was able to get into Stanford University as a Biology major and is now a Biology researcher at a prestigious research lab.

interactivePoints.text: I'm always the first one to arrive at school, if I ever arrive late, I would have to face Juan, the school bully, and I don't want that to happen.
It's AP Bio today, my favorite class, I'm planning on majoring in Biology in college, but first I need to do well on the AP Bio exam coming soon, and the Biology olympiad.

Ms. Khan usually comes early, and we get to chat about our favorite Biology topics, I was going to talk about the new research paper I'm writing, I hope she likes it, she's the only person I can trust in this school.
I look at the time, its 7:20 AM, still 30 minutes before the bell rings, I barely slept yesterday, I was cramming for the Biology olympiad and the PSAT, I need to get the National Merit Scholarship.

I'm staying at my cousin's house today, it's been over a month where my parents have been homeless, my uncle refuses to help my parents out, he says the most he could do is to take me in, I really hope their okay.
I'm cramming for the International Biology olympiad, I need to win this scholarship, for me, for my parents, for my future.
This plant is my favorite, it's the only thing I brought over from my old house, it's the only thing that reminds me of myself, and my love for Biology, I hope it grows well here.
Dear Student, you have been admitted into Stanford! Congratulations, Dean of School
Look at the other desk for the college admission letters
Dear Student, you have been rejected from Berkeley. I am sorry to inform you this. Regards, Dean of School
I was able to go to Stanford for nearly free of charge, this is because I was a National Merit Scholar Finalist, I also was also able to get Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)

I made it, just looking at these tools shows the journey I went through to become a Biology scientist at a prestigious research lab. I was able to get my family out of debt and moved them to an apartment, my hard work really paid off!
I'm doing what I love, I'm currently researching and developing a new treatment for pancreatic cancer, it's something my father suffered with.
This lab reminds me of what I can do with hard work and dedication, I hope I could inspire you to pursuit what you are passionate about, and specific ways you can achieve this.
